dict.string: Tests correctness of resolving hostnames with ordinary DNS using the GAIPerf Advanced test suite.
Tests correctness of resolving hostnames with DNS over TLS (DoT) using the GAIPerf Advanced test suite.
Tests correctness of resolving hostnames with DNS over HTTPS (DoH) using the GAIPerf Advanced test suite.
Tests mDNSResponder's DNS querying. Verifies that mDNSResponder doesn't send more A/AAAA queries than necessary.
Tests mDNSResponder's ability to quickly recover from a transient DNS outage.
Tests whether mDNSResponder retries queries with a different server if a given server is unresponsive. Also tests mDNSResponder's handling of DNS responses with every possible RCODE.
Tests mDNSResponder's defense mechanism of falling back to TCP when a response with an invalid message ID, but which is otherwise acceptable, is received over UDP.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of one service instance with one one-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of one service instance with one one-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 500-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 500-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of one service instance with one one-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record. Cache is not flushed beforehand.
mDNS Discovery 1-1-1 (No Cache Flush, No Additionals)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of one service instance with one one-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record. Cache is not flushed beforehand. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Cache is not flushed beforehand.
mDNS Discovery 10-100-2 (No Cache Flush, No Additionals)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Cache is not flushed beforehand. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 500-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Cache is not flushed beforehand.
mDNS Discovery 100-500-2 (No Cache Flush, No Additionals)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 500-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Cache is not flushed beforehand. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records over IPv4. The first three responses per service instance are subject to a 0.5 probability of being dropped to test query retries.

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records over IPv6. The first three responses per service instance are subject to a 0.5 probability of being dropped to test query retries.

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records over IPv4. The first three responses per service instance are subject to a 0.5 probability of being dropped to test query retries.

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records over IPv6. The first three responses per service instance are subject to a 0.5 probability of being dropped to test query retries.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of one service instance with one one-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of one service instance with one one-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 500-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 500-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
mDNS Discovery 1-1-1 (No Cache Flush, New GAI)
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of one service instance with one one-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record. Cache is not flushed beforehand.
mDNS Discovery 1-1-1 (No Cache Flush, No Additionals, New GAI)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of one service instance with one one-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record. Cache is not flushed beforehand. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
mDNS Discovery 10-100-2 (No Cache Flush, New GAI)
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Cache is not flushed beforehand.
mDNS Discovery 10-100-2 (No Cache Flush, No Additionals, New GAI)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Cache is not flushed beforehand. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
mDNS Discovery 100-500-2 (No Cache Flush, New GAI)
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 500-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Cache is not flushed beforehand.
mDNS Discovery 100-500-2 (No Cache Flush, No Additionals, New GAI)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 500-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records. Cache is not flushed beforehand. Responses from mdnsreplier contain no additional answers.
mDNS Discovery w/Packet Drops 10 (IPv4, New GAI)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records over IPv4. The first three responses per service instance are subject to a 0.5 probability of being dropped to test query retries.
mDNS Discovery w/Packet Drops 10 (IPv6, New GAI)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of ten service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records over IPv6. The first three responses per service instance are subject to a 0.5 probability of being dropped to test query retries.
mDNS Discovery w/Packet Drops 100 (IPv4, New GAI)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records over IPv4. The first three responses per service instance are subject to a 0.5 probability of being dropped to test query retries.
mDNS Discovery w/Packet Drops 100 (IPv6, New GAI)

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 100 service instances with one 100-byte TXT record, two A records, and two AAAA records over IPv6. The first three responses per service instance are subject to a 0.5 probability of being dropped to test query retries.
Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 500 service instances with one 200-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record.

Tests mDNS discovery and resolution of 500 service instances with one 200-byte TXT record, one A record, and one AAAA record. Also, requires that mDNSResponder's heap memory growth doesn't exceed 3.2 MB. Note: This test comes after the "mDNS Discovery 500-200-1" test to ensure that mDNSResponder's record cache capacity doesn't have to grow during this test because we don't want increases to mDNSResponder's record cache capacity to be misconstrued as memory growth for client requests.
Tests DNS and mDNS queries for domain names in the local domain.

Tests various probe conflict scenarios, some of which are expected to result in service instance and record renames. The test service is registered on the loopback interface. The probe conflicts occur over IPv4 via the loopback interface.

Tests various probe conflict scenarios, some of which are expected to result in service instance and record renames. The test service is registered on the loopback interface. The probe conflicts occur over IPv6 via the loopback interface.
Probe Conflicts (Registration On Any Interface, IPv4)

Tests various probe conflict scenarios, some of which are expected to result in service instance and record renames. The test service is registered using the kDNSServiceInterfaceIndexAny interface index. The probe conflicts occur over IPv4 via the loopback interface.
Probe Conflicts (Registration On Any Interface, IPv6)

Tests various probe conflict scenarios, some of which are expected to result in service instance and record renames. The test service is registered using the kDNSServiceInterfaceIndexAny interface index. The probe conflicts occur over IPv6 via the loopback interface.

Test the following situation: 1. The interface is set to expensive and inexpensive, and the query is set to DenyExpensive, a continuous ADD/REMOVE sequence is expected. 2. The interface is set to expensive and inexpensive, and the query does not DenyExpensive, no update is expected. 3. The interface is set to constrained and unconstrained, and the query is set to DenyConstrained, a continuous ADD/REMOVE sequence is expected. 4. The interface is set to constrained and unconstrained, and the query does not DenyConstrained, no update is expected. 5. The interface is set to expensive and constrained, and the query is set to DenyExpensive and DenyConstrained.

Tests mDNSResponder's DNS proxy by sending it a variety of queries and verifying the responses. The queries are sent via UDP and TCP to the DNS proxy's IPV4 and IPv6 addresses. The DNS proxy is tested while it runs in different modes. Aside from the mode without a DNS64 prefix, the DNS proxy is tested while it runs with all of the valid DNS64 prefix lengths: 32-bit, 40-bit, 48-bit, 56-bit, 64-bit, and 96-bit. Uses mrc_dns_proxy to start the DNS proxies.

Tests mDNSResponder's DNS proxy by sending it a variety of queries and verifying the responses. The queries are sent via UDP and TCP to the DNS proxy's IPV4 and IPv6 addresses. The DNS proxy is tested while it runs in different modes. Aside from the mode without a DNS64 prefix, the DNS proxy is tested while it runs with all of the valid DNS64 prefix lengths: 32-bit, 40-bit, 48-bit, 56-bit, 64-bit, and 96-bit. Uses the legacy client SPI to start the DNS proxies, i.e., DNSXEnableProxy() and DNSXEnableProxy64().

1. Tests whether the state dump can be triggered correctly, and whether the file (or stdout's output) contains the full state information. 2. Checks whether the number of state dump files has an upper limit to avoid wasting disk space.
Verifies any issues with multiple simultanious connections from a client
Verifies if mDNSResponder could handle the basic DNSSEC validation
Gathers performance metrics and performs daemon-related checks after a simple kickstart of mDNSResponder daemon
Test if the HMAC MD5 utilities in DNSDigest.c can generate the correct digest.
Test base 64 and base 32 HEX encoding.
Test the DNSSEC validation capability of mDNSResponder when the validation result is Secure, with different number of address records and different DNSKEY algorithms.
SRP Client Changes Text Record, SRP Server Does DNSServiceUpdateRecord.
Verify service and host entries are removed when the lease provided by the SRP client expires.
Verify service is renewed upon request from the client when the current lease is about to expire.
Test that when we generate a DNS Update message and deliver it through the SRP replication input path, it is successfully registered.

Test that when we generate two DNS Update message, each of which adds a single instance, and deliver them together through the SRP replication input path, both are successfully registered, and the host registration is only done once and not renewed.

Test that when we generate two DNS Update message, the first of which adds two instances, and the second of which removes the first instance, and then we deliver them together through the SRP replication input path, the second is successfully registered, but the first is never registered, and the host registration and second instance registration are done exactly once and not renewed.

test that an SRP client registers a host with no instances through the primary SRP server, and the update message is delivered to the other SRP server through SRPL connection and then the host is registered on that SRP server.
Two-instance SRPL registration + remove test with duplicate

The goal of this test is to generate two DNS Update messages, both for the same host, each containing a new registration for a different instance, and deliver it through the SRP replication input path. Having passed the update set once we then deliver it a second time to see that it is correctly ignored. VARIANT: test that if the two updates contain the same messages, the second set are ignored.
Two-instance SRPL registration + remove test with duplicate of first message only

The goal of this test is to generate two DNS Update messages, both for the same host, each containing a new registration for a different instance, and deliver it through the SRP replication input path. Having passed the update set once we then deliver it a second time to see that it is correctly ignored. VARIANT: test that if the second updates contain only the first message, it is ignored.
Two-instance SRPL registration + remove test with duplicate of last message only

The goal of this test is to generate two DNS Update messages, both for the same host, each containing a new registration for a different instance, and deliver it through the SRP replication input path. Having passed the update set once we then deliver it a second time to see that it is correctly ignored. VARIANT: test that if the second updates contain only the last message, it is ignored.
Two-instance SRPL registration + remove, then add a new instance plus dupes of the original messages

The goal of this test is to generate two DNS Update messages, both for the same host, each containing a new registration for a different instance, and deliver it through the SRP replication input path. Having passed the update set once we then deliver it a second time to see that it is correctly ignored. VARIANT: test that if the second update starts with a new third instance, it is added.
Two-instance SRPL registration + remove plus duplicates of these messages and a new instance add

The goal of this test is to generate two DNS Update messages, both for the same host, each containing a new registration for a different instance, and deliver it through the SRP replication input path. Having passed the update set once we then deliver it a second time to see that it is correctly ignored. VARIANT: test that if the second update ends with a new third instance, it is added.
Two-instance SRPL registration + remove with different keys

The goal of this test is to generate two DNS Update messages, both for the same host, each containing a new registration for a different instance, and deliver it through the SRP replication input path. Having passed the update set once we then deliver it a second time to see that it is correctly ignored. VARIANT: test that if the two updates are signed with different keys, they are rejected.
